item.title: When Grief Came for the Gravedigger
item.description: In pursuit of an interesting life, he came face to face with death.

item.title: Can I Cut Ties With a Friend Who Helped Me Through a Hard Time?
item.description: As I recovered from my heartbreak, I started to notice he had some views that I couldn’t disagree with more.

item.title: What It Means to Be a White ‘Race Traitor’
item.description: From Schwerner and Goodman to Good and Pretti, white people putting themselves in harm’s way has helped galvanize Americans for justice.

item.title: Does Your Wife Have to Buy Groceries That Disgust Her?
item.description: A ruling on a dispute over deli-case tuna salad.

item.title: Key Moments in Gisèle Pelicot’s Interview With The Times
item.description: The woman at the center of France’s largest-ever mass-rape trial told us about her life before, during and after the abuse she suffered at the hands of her husband.

item.title: My First Child Has a Genetic Syndrome. Can I Use I.V.F. to Spare My Second?
item.description: With such a small risk of illness, does this type of embryo selection border on eugenics?

item.title: Do I Have to Take Over the Family Company if I Can’t Stand My Cousin?
item.description: I can’t picture spending the rest of my career working with him.

item.title: Is It OK to ‘Teach a Lesson’ to Strangers?
item.description: A ruling on a mother’s curious locker-room practice.

item.title: The Wellness Guru Jay Shetty Has Raised Some Doubts. Including His Own.
item.description: The self-help influencer on his values, his journey and criticism of his work.

item.title: We’re the Guardians of a Difficult Teenager. What Do We Owe Them?
item.description: I’ve found myself carrying negative feelings that I don’t want but can’t quite shake.

item.title: "I Had No Idea How to Handle That”: The Drama Behind a Tense Ice Skating Moment
item.description: In 1994, the Olympics were rocked by a giant skating scandal. When it was all over, three athletes waited for their medals.

item.title: Toni Morrison Was a Master of the Unthinkable
item.description: What made her one of our greatest — and most dangerous — novelists was her belief that stories could contain what our minds couldn’t confront.

item.title: They Killed Their Abusers. Should They Spend Their Lives in Prison?
item.description: A new law was supposed to help reduce the sentences of survivors of domestic violence. Most are still behind bars.

item.title: They Fought for the C.I.A. in Afghanistan. In America, They’re Living in Fear.
item.description: A shooting in Washington, D.C., threw their immigration status into jeopardy — and brought attention to a long-hidden dimension of America’s war.
